feed.title: DeFi⚓Navy
feed.subtitle: Links to the world of DeFi and more cool stuff.

entry.title: Contribution guide
entry.content:
How do I contribute to DeFi⚓Navy?

Note: This is the readme of our website contributions repo on GitHub.

To help contribute with the website you must create an issue and follow the instructions for whatever is needed in each form.

Please read carefully the instructions in each issue posting form before submitting an issue.

Some quick links to create specific issues

  • Add a new link

  • Modify an existing link

  • Fix a broken link

  • Submit a bug report

Financials

If you want to help us cover running costs, you can send any ERC-20 tokens or ETH to definavy.eth or the address it points to: 0x1Ac6400091c188079C1d216427a182193c20f986

Or just share the site around, any help is appreciated!
entry.summary: How do I contribute to DeFi⚓Navy?

entry.title: Welcome to DeFi Navy
entry.content:
Our experiment

Hi!, welcome to DeFi Navy. We’re a small team of dudes that want to make the world of DeFi a little easier to explore. Dozens of people are building super cool sites for many different purposes, exploring blockchain data, dapps, news, media, all sorts of things. These are super hard to track, since they’re shared around in forums and there’s SO many popping up at the same time.

We want to make the simplest possible website to find relevant DeFi links, no bullshit, no ads, just links.

We hope you enjoy the site and we hope we can help you find what you’re looking for.

This project is open source, so anyone is welcome to contribute. Check out our contribution guide to add your own links, or maybe even correct ours if they’re wrong!

Thanks for checking out the site, we hope you like it!
